abstract: Authors Guild and others request more time in the Google book-scanning case.
snippet: Authors Guild and others request more time in the Google book-scanning case.
lead_paragraph: The Authors Guild, Association of American Publishers and other plaintiffs in the original lawsuit against Google over its program to scan millions of library books and make them searchable online have requested a postponement of a court fairness hearing scheduled for Oct. 7.

headline.main: More Time Requested in Google Book Scanning Case

abstract: The Authors Guild and others are requesting more time for negotiations in the Google book-scanning case.
snippet: The Authors Guild and others are requesting more time for negotiations in the Google book-scanning case.

headline.main: More Time Requested in Google Book Scanning Case

abstract: The sale of advertising keywords does not amount to trademark infringement, the adviser to the European Union’s top court said.
snippet: The sale of advertising keywords does not amount to trademark infringement, the adviser to the European Union’s top court said.
lead_paragraph: PARIS  A legal adviser to the European Union’s top court backed Google in a trademark case on Tuesday, saying the company should be allowed to sell brand names like Louis Vuitton or Coca-Cola as advertising keywords.

headline.main: European Adviser Backs Google on Trademarks
headline.print_headline: European Adviser Backs Google on Trademarks
